title: >>> The One before ONE
body_text:
A surprising poster contest, the fourth consecutive rimshot contest, rain and wind. Sounds like DODGEBALL 53 doesn't it!!
DODGEBALL 53 Records
- Attendance: 18
- New Players: 0
- Biggest Return: Jim Martin (Last played at DODGEBALL 42)
- DODGEBALL 53 was "Wet War XII".
- Despite his absence, Letsche's wooden rims were used.
- The fourth rimshot contest took place, with two players emerging victorious; Derek Carty and Chris Adams.
- Derek's loss brought his record to an all-time low of 0-4. Chris however remained undefeated (in singles action). Throw in the team battle from DODGEBALL 50 and his record stands at 3-1.
>> Poster Contest results ...
1st: #3 (Created by Dan Spengeman) - 56%
2nd: #2 (Created by Dan Spengeman) - 32%
3rd: #1 (Created by Dan Spengeman) - 12%
From Death to Birth
From the death of the captains championship to the birth of the rimshot competition, dodgeball has seen several changes in just a few short weeks. At DODGEBALL 50, brothers Chris and Tom Adams secured their names in the record books for life, winning the first contest of its kind.
As the next events followed, what supposedly came off as a one-time only idea returned. Now a rimshot legend, Ryan Letsche would pull off not one but two huge victories for the right to face then-champion Kevin Adams.
At DODGEBALL 53, the world witnessed the first co-winners of such a contest. Unlike DODGEBALL 50 however, the two players would each become one-half of the night's main event, earning a captain's position against one another.
Diana DiBuccio, Sara DeCuir, Kurt Gassner, John Tronolone, Chris Adams, Derek Carty, Kevin Adams, and Jim Martin all competed in the fourth rimshot contest to date.
The first round witnessed the rise of a single winner in Derek Carty. But left without an opponent he was. After round two, Diana, John, and Chris would move to the semis. It took a good few minutes, but in the end, Chris Adams was left standing.
Derek Carty vs. Chris Adams
Two of the sports biggest icons closed out the first year of dodgeball in an epic encounter. Derek knew his past tries as team general were all so close, but had still yet to see his first win. Having only lost in the colossal team battle along with his three brothers at DODGEBALL 50, Chris remained a top singles captain with a 2 and 0 record.
With captains the caliber of Carty and Adams, there was no question that DODGEBALL 53 would go down as one of the most action-packed events ever!
It started off extremely well for Derek; the first three wins of the night. Despite Chris's tremendous showing, Derek's team as a whole appeared more focused. But of course things do change a lot in dodgeball don't they!
After a good two-hours plus of intense competition, the score had seen a drastic change; all tied up! The final game would decide once and for all who walked out of DODGEBALL 53 as the victor. And unfortunately for Derek, he just happened to be on the losing end. The extra point went to the powerhouse Adams. The always resilient Derek Carty lost his fourth captains battle.
Chris Adams defeated Derek Carty at DODGEBALL 53, 6 - 5.
The Legend and The NewBlood
Chris Adams debuted some 50 events ago on September 10th, 2005. From that day forward, he became one of the most respected veterans to ever grace the dodgeball playing grounds. His success has never slowed, with proof of his dominance at DODGEBALL 53. In the early goings of the event, it was he who single-handedly carried the team. After several members of his team got their acts together, he was still a one-man wrecking crew. Key throwing eliminations, a number of life-saving rimshots, and athletic dodging allowed for teammates and opponents alike to only admire such a showing. And keep in mind, he was barefoot!
DODGEBALL 50 was a great event for new-comer Brent Bitsko. Members of the opposing team that night voiced their frustrations after difficulty hitting the quick and agile dodger. Continuing off the success of his debut, he missed not one step at DODGEBALL 53. Dodging comes so natural to the youngster and offensively, pinpoint accuracy gave him much to brag about.
The One Year Anniversary ... DODGEBALL 54
One year ago, one man had a vision. It began at Ocean Road Park and it would change OUR world.
Celebrate the 1st birthday of dodgeball when DODGEBALL 54 hits Ocean Road Park on Sunday, September 3, 2006. The festivities begin at 6pm.
What to expect thus far:
- Valerie Winston vs. Lauren Winston in a DODGEBALL DAY 1 rematch!
- Foam footballs return! Painballs included!
- An "artificial Wet War"?
Check back during the week for more!
